context_bundle.summary: Terraform declarative Infrastructure as Code (IaC) for multi-cloud provisioning: write .tf files with resources (aws_instance, azurerm_virtual_machine), providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), variables, outputs. terraform init (download providers), terraform plan (preview), terraform apply (create), terraform destroy (delete). State management (local/remote). Modules for reusability. HCL syntax: resource 'type' 'name' { attributes }.

onboarding.quick_start: Terraform workflow: write main.tf with provider 'aws' { region = 'us-east-1' }, resource 'aws_instance' 'web' { ami = 'ami-123', instance_type = 't2.micro' }. Commands: terraform init (initialize), terraform plan (preview changes), terraform apply (execute), terraform destroy (tear down). Variables: variable 'region' { default = 'us-east-1' }, reference as var.region. Outputs: output 'instance_ip' { value = aws_instance.web.public_ip }. State: terraform.tfstate tracks resources. Remote backend: backend 's3' { bucket = 'tfstate' }.
common_patterns: Data source: data 'aws_ami' 'ubuntu' { most_recent = true, owners = ['099720109477'] }
Workflow: terraform init -> terraform plan -> terraform apply
Format: terraform fmt, Validate: terraform validate
Import existing: terraform import aws_instance.web i-1234567890
